intro: Leptogastrodia exilis, commonly known as the slender globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This perennial herb typically grows in dry, rocky soils and has small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are pale yellow to greenish-yellow, with five petals and a distinctive, rounded calyx. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
